Description: one spacer-bead and nine beads made in different shapes and materials. A: One short spacer-bead made of turquoise faience, two segment preserved, broken off at both ends. B: One disc-shaped bead made of faience with egyptian blue coloured glaze. C: One barrel-shaped bead made of a white stone. Drilled through from both sides. D: Four segmented cylindrical beads, two made in white and two in blue faience. E: Two small disc-shaped beads made of white faience. F: One flattened sphere bead made of white faience, slightly irregular. G: One barrel-shaped bead made of glass, now corroded to a pearlescent colour except for a circular area in a pinkish colour.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
